title: Why the hell do people want Shaco buffed?
body: There's literally NO NEED for one, I was against a tank Shaco just now and he still bursts like it's nothing, if anything tank Shaco should be rendered useless, no buff.

Shaco's isn't an ult and has no drawbacks like the others who don't have it as an ult,

Now here's the thing, everyone who can't be seen (besides Shaco) have some form of drawback, I listed them above.

The thing is, if you play shaco you will noticed that he relies entirely on either his q or very well placed boxes, with the q having a fair cd, and it not doing a shit tonne of damage in comparison to what alot of other abilities do, his q actually is a well made ability seeing as its not OP and actually needs to be used correctly or it could cost you your life. All the champs you mentioned have very high and reliable damage (maybe not teemo as much) which they can put out consistently, which shaco cannot do as well as these champs, because once youve used your empowered q+auto, the only thing you have to do damage is your e, and tbh that ability is shithouse until later on in the game (apart from the passive thats neato!). So with his q being half of his burst kit, his mobility, and his engage/escape, you can see how that has its drawbacks. His W and R have to be used relatively well otherwise they are just downright useless, and you already know about his e. 

Shaco doesn't need a buff, hes fine where he is. Should his q be different? HELL NO. Just because you got killed by tank shaco doesnt make it "OP". Ive been fucked by a jungle thresh (who im pretty sure was a smurf), but that doesnt make jungle thresh "OP" either, he was just played well, and you probably played into him, which is just unlucky.

So you're going to ignore the fact that you straight up incorrectly stated that Shaco has the ONLY TRUE STEALTH ABILITY in the game? And then you're going to try to breakdown how Shaco's stealth is "moar op" than the other champs? Let me set this straight for you:

Shaco's Q - Deceive lasts 5 seconds at max rank. With max cdr (cooldown reduction), i believe its on a 5 or 6 second cd (cooldown). Its 10 seconds at lvl 1. He can place his W - Jack in the Box and not break invis and potentially fear an entire team for 2 seconds at max rank (.75 second fear at rank 1) and do a little to a lot of damage (the JitB can only target one opponent at a time tho) depending on your build. He can also jump walls with it/dodge skill shots and abilities as it "flashes" him towards his cursor, similar to flash, but a lower range.

Wukong's W - Decoy is.. oh idk cuz i dont play him much, but on a 8ish sec cd at max rank (with cdr i believe its at 4-6 seconds). The decoy clone and stealth last for 2ish seconds. However, his ultimate can literally knock up an entire team as well as deal significant damage to all who stay in it. So, if played correctly, Wukong's stealth is by far a greater threat. The decoy clone slows, deals a small amount of damage, and can completely confuse an enemy team, causing them to possibly waste entire ultimate abilities/summoner spells on a clone that lasts about 1.5 seconds. WUKONG'S STEALTH IS SHACO'S Q - DECEIVE AND R - HALLUCINATE'S LOVECHILD. ARE YOU EFFIN SERIOUS BRUH.

Kha,Zhix's stealth is "for a brief moment" over and over again. Kha has stealth from his R - Void Assault, but also is granted passive stealth if he chooses to evolve his R. Anytime he enters new brush, he gains that stealth passive (i believe there is a 9 second cd per brush) as well as his R allows him to go invis, gain dmg reduc (possibly changed, but at one point it did), gain a short burst of movement speed, and resets his passive which grants him a good chunk of dmg from his passive - Unseen Predator. Did i mention that when he stealths in brush, he once again resets his passive? Kha can literally take a path thru the jungle that, if he's evolved his R, he will have constant stealth from each brush while doing massive damage if you're isolated... But... Ya know... Its only for a breif moment...

Akali is not only invisible in just a small radius, but she also does a mini-flash in the direction of your cursor, as well as gains a movement speed boost while in her W - Twilight Shroud that persists for a brief moment after she leaves the shroud. She also has massive burst damage, insane burst potential, great sustain, and is manaless. Shaco relies on blue buff to be able to be a constant threat. Akali just needs to wait 2.5 seconds (guesstimating, for you nitpickers) for her energy to regen. I will grant you, Shaco's stealth is arguably "better" than Akali's, but it depends on the situation and what you're using the stealth for. If you're trying to farm, Shaco's stealth is terrible: He breaks stealth once he auto attacks and has to wait for the cd to refresh. Akali is revealed for a brief moment but then restealths after a short moment until the shroud dissipates (something like 5-8 seconds). Thats a pretty handy tool. 

Teemo's stealth is almost more useful than Shaco's as Teemo can be invisible INDEFINITELY. Unless you grab a red trinket or a champion with a stealth revealing ablility (*looking* at you Lee Sin... lmfao that never gets old), Teemo can literally stay invis an entire game. THAT'S PRETTY RIDICULOUS. Not only can he stealth, he can move around while stealthed in a bush and gains 40% attack speed (atk spd) after breaking stealth. Not to mention his shrooms can deal massive damage, slow an entire enemy team, and remain 4 times longer than Shaco's JitB. Teemo's stealth is activated by simply staying still for 2ish seconds i believe (twice as fast if he's in brush) and takes no mana to "cast". Talk about drawbacks.

Vayne Vayne Vayne. I can't even believe you're sitting here trying to tell me that Vayne's stealth is in any way worse than Shaco's. Would you like to know why? I'll tell you: RANGED TRUE DMG BRUH. Okay, you count the amount of games Vayne has been played in pro and I'll count the Shaco games and then we'll take a look and see which champ has carried harder shall we? While on paper Vayne's stealth seems like its at a huge disadvantage, you're forgetting several key components: THE REST OF VAYNE'S KIT AND EFFING RANGED TRUE DMG BRUH. Vayne can dodge/reposition with her Q - Tumble (which also conveniently activates her stealth if her she's casted her ultimate), has RANGED EFFING TRUE DMG with her W - Silver Bolts, has a KNOCKBACK with the possibility to STUN if her enemy collides with terrain on her E - Condemn, as well as passive movement speed when moving towards enemies as well as other passive effects from her ultimate (increased movement speed is the only one i can remember off the top of my head). Let me also put this in perspective. Vayne can 2 shot a carry with no stealth from 500 or so units aka RANGED. Shaco has to either 2 shot with his E - Two-Shiv Poison (if he built straight AP), which would take at least 10 seconds as its on a 4-5 second cd at max rank as well as terrible positioning TWICE from the carry who didnt back after the first time they were nearly nuked, OR, Shaco has to Q - Deceive directly on top of the carry, potentially being focused himself, and not guaranteeing the kill, especially if his R - Deceive is on cd. Did I mention RANGED TRUE DMG????

IN CONCLUSION, NOT only were you completely incorrect in stating that Shaco had the ONLY true stealth ability in the game, you are by and far completely off the mark when addressing how the other characters stealth abilities and mechanics fair against Shaco's. The only change to Shaco's stealth they should make is to reduce the amount of stealth from 5 seconds to 3 or 4. Other than that, Shaco's stealth is completely in line in terms of "power", especially when compared with other champs stealth abilities. 

Sincerely,

Call Me BigPappa a Shaco main and Bard GOD

First off, you're obviously not a true player. In any sense of the words. And Shaco's stealth is possibly the best stealth ability in the game if not for the fact that to do any damage he must be literally on top of an enemy champion. You either get focused and pick up the kill, or you get focused and die. Only great Shaco's can survive a teamfight; either that, or your opponents are unskilled. Unless Shaco sets up proper boxes before an engage, which means 20-30 seconds of planning and prophetic strategizing, he is completely useless in teamfights. 5 seconds of stealth means nothing when you have to literally be behind enemy frontliners to deal damage. In a game where all players have some semblance of teamwork and knowledge of their role (meaning not bronze, silver, and basically most of gold), Shaco's stealth is easily handled. The only nerf it could use would be, like i said, to reduce the amount of stealth from 5 to 3 seconds, as even I am surprised at how long im able to stay stealthed while juking entire enemy teams, and/or increase the cooldown from 10-15 seconds at rank 1, scaling down sto 10 seconds at max rank. Other than that, if Shaco didnt have that crazy burst, he'd be a walking pile of health constantly trying to bait people into boxes and hoping their dumb enough to follow him. Get real man, you're just salty cuz you get crushed time and again by him and you're mad now. We get it.

Edit: Even when building ap, where he has a ranged mini nuke he can launch from stealth, he has to be in range of a multitude of cc abilities which any decent team would have ready and available. You just need to learn how to beat Shaco. First: Stop Chasing -_-

I wouldn't say that AP Shaco jungle post Gunblade nerfs is strong. He is played rarely since then as AP in the jungle to the point that there is not enough data on various sites. The current problem with Shaco is his bruiser build.

Bruiser build is way too forgiving on him and is extremely unhealthy with his long duration of stealth. With Trinity and Titanic he is bursting down squishies better than with Lethality/Crit build path and after he is done with their squishies he can DPS with clone while being hard to kill. There is really not planning or mechanical outplays or macro involved in it, you just roflstomp their team.
In order to stabilize win rate on this build (win rate speaking) there must be some power shifts in his kit and change of base stats in favor of scalling (but that is just my opinion).

Is AD Shaco harder now? Yes, and this is because his AD scalings and base damage got nerfed and he must rush Tiamat no matter what making his Lethality stacking slower and his early damage lower. But his stealth and current damage still lets him to apply pressure, taking kills without much thought required.

Currently AP Shaco seems to be in the most balanced state out of all build paths (not as weak as AD, not as strong as Bruiser): 52% in the Top lane with 0,6% pick rate and also represents Riot's philosophy with tricking stuff.
